intro: Zieridium gracile, commonly known as the slender zieridium, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its delicate, yellow flowers bloom in spring, adding a subtle ornamental value to gardens. Zieridium gracile is often cultivated for its compact size and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
